CSSStyleRule.summary: The CSSStyleRule interface represents a single CSS style rule.

CSSStyleRuleSelectorText.summary: The selectorText property of the interface gets and sets the selectors associated with the CSSStyleRule.

CSSStyleRuleStyle.summary: The read-only style property of the interface contains a object representing the properties list in this style rule's body.

remarks.para:
Each CSS property supported by the browser is present on the object.
The properties that are not defined inline in the corresponding CSS declaration are set to the empty string ("").

CSSStyleRuleStyle.value:
A object.
NOTEEarlier versions of the specification returned a , which is now the base class of .
See the browser compatibility table for browser support information.Although the style property itself is read-only in the sense that you can't replace the CSSStyleProperties object, you can still assign to the style property directly, which is equivalent to assigning to its property. You can also modify the CSSStyleProperties object using the and methods.

CSSStyleRuleStyleMap.summary:
The styleMap read-only property of the
interface returns a object
which provides access to the rule's property-value pairs.
